page.title: 14SAILMAKERS
page.content: The River Blackwater is well known for its barges and their sails are still made in Maldon. On the Hythe is Taylors the sail- makers.The firm has been there for over one hundred years.The sail loft is made of weatherboarding and was built in 1709 and was originally a grainstore.The sails are still made traditionally.We watched Roy Howe and John Raven sewing sails by hand and using a machine.Mr Raven has worked there for thirty years and his grand- father for 66 years before him.Mr Raven works at the same bench as his grandfather and still uses some of his tools. Taylors make sails for all kinds of boats.They make and repair the sails for the Thames sailing barges from flax which is dyed with ochre and oil. Sailmaking is an important feature.
